page.title: 03Introduction to Yarlet Area
page.content:
mechanisation on farms and greater mobility for house holders. There is only one sizeable wood in the area, at the 905294. It is owned by Staffordshire County Council and has recently been felled because of elm disease, but has been replanted. It is an important wild life reserve here.
YARLET BANK FARM ________________
The farms in the east of this area are considerably smaller than those in the west, being hiller and having a heavy, marl soil. Our farm covers about 40 acres and is long and narrow in shape. Mr Veron, the tenant farmer, has 40 dairy cows which are mainly Ayrshires through
